page.title: 03HOWNAM CHURCH AND PARISH
page.content: This parish has suffered depopulation during the last forty years, and three ministerial changes in twelve years gives indication of this unsettling influence.In 1956 it was linked with Yetholm and united with Morebattle in 1972.These three parishes now share a minister with Linton.Services are held fortnightly with an average of 10 people,but on Christmas Eve the church built in 1752 to seat 226 is full with other parishes attending.In the summer the Kelso Laddie and followers visit, ensuring a large congregation. Holy Communion is celebrated 4 times each year and since 1970 11 children from the parish have been baptised. Hownam women are invited to join Morebattle Women's Guild, and the children asked to Morebattle Sunday School.There are some thirty members and adherents on the congregational roll.
